Fields.DialogueText: Emden, look out! That was almost a direct hit!
That was close, but they will not defeat me today.
@BATTLE
Kapitän! I've sent Suchtrupps to several locations, abroad... and at home.
Germany? That's interesting. Do you suspect the students being taken was an inside job?
Unlikely, as we just recently reunited the prized Gutenberg Bibel with its rightful owner. But I can't be too cautious.

Fields.MenuText: You think that the Party might want to recruit them somehow?
What if the Morganas took them?
Maybe they're just skipping school?

Fields.DialogueText: For what? They've already grown up in the Hitlerjugend and the party list is currently closed. Again. I do wish they'd stay in the Universität, though...
We haven't found them yet in any Gefecht with the Nixe. That's a fate I would never wish on anyone.
My Studenten love my Vorlesungen! They'd never skip it!
I have a positive feeling we'll find them.
It's not only a matter of finding them. It's knowing that they are safe and unharmed. The Universität of Göttingen must know. *sigh* The NSLB must know. And the Reichsministerium für.....
Let's calm down a bit and think about any other places they might have ended up.
You're right. I think I'll go build a Buddelschiff and give the matter some thought. Basteln always helps me think.
I'm sure you'll figure something out, Emden. You're a precise and methodical person.
Danke, Kapitän. Sometimes I must remind myself of that.
Captain! We require your assistance.
With what?
Well, with her students missing, and feeling a compelling need to share her knowledge with someone, Schiffsdame Emden is trying to teach us Infinity... something.

Fields.MenuText: She wants to teach you Infinity? Are you alright, Lieutenant?
That sounds way too hard. Every crew member for themselves!
We'd better find her students soon, then.

Fields.DialogueText: Absolutely not, my head is buzzing.
What?! You can't just abandon ship like that!
I agree! I don't know when she'll give us the next surprise quiz again.
Ah! Hello, Fräulein Emden!
Ack!
Leutnant, there you are! We've been waiting for you to come back in die Vorlesung. Those Differentialgleichungen won't solve themselves.
*ALARM*
I'm safe... uh, I mean, we'll have to save the test for later.
More time to study, then! And this will be on the next Test.
Show me. ... .... ..... That looks like calculus, no?
@BATTLE
Can you at least grade it on a curve?
I had not planned on it, Kapitän... but regardless, I think you are going to pass with ease.
Any updates or leads on your students yet, Emden?
Not yet, Kapitän. This is such a Alptraum. Pinch me. I need to wake up.

Fields.MenuText: Someone doesn't want your students to be found.
I wonder if the Soviets took them...
All this investigating sure has made me hungry.

Fields.DialogueText: But for what purpose? Why would they want with semi-trained Ingenieure?
Averse as I am to share the seas with these Gottlosen, I have heard nothing from my Kontakte among them.
Help yourself to an Apfelring. I brought in a fresh batch this morning. A sweet always puts me in a better mood.
We must be diligent.
It's just like Minenräumen. Everything needs to be systematically searched across the map.
I have been thinking, though.
Oh?
They are Maschinenbaustudenten. Literate and well-educated. They could be of use to someone who is trying to get an insight into German technology.
Does that help narrow our leads?
Not much, I'm afraid. I think we need to set our course to Finland.
What's in Finland?
Help for getting back my Studenten.
*ALARM*
I hope they can also help against the Morganas!
Only if something needed to be acquired from the Nixen.
@BATTLE
You're meeting with who?
That's right. Our eleven Bibeldieben.

Fields.MenuText: "Bible thieves" are not the most trustworthy partners I can imagine.
I don't understand. Explain to me why you want to meet with them?
Are you some type of criminal mastermind?

Fields.DialogueText: That doesn't mean they can't be of use.
It's more out of need than want. They heard about the disappearance of the Studenten and offered to help retrieve them.
Ha, ha! If I was, we would have more money to upgrade my Schiff...
What if they secretly took your students and are trying to lure you in with this entrapment?
I trust in Gottes Plan. They are an ambitious group up for a challenge. They've offered to help and it would be dumm to not consider it.
Besides, I need a Prüfungsaufsicht...
Proctors?
Yes, some of my Schüler... I mean, my Mannschaft...  are cheating on their Infinitesimalrechnungsexamen! I'm beaufsichtige the Tests from now on. It takes a cheater to catch a cheater.
*ALARM*
I hope it's not "it takes a Morgana to catch a Morgana."
Was? Why would you put a Nixe on my Schiff? I don't want to corrupt the minds of my Schüler!
@BATTLE
Emden, what are you working on?
Oh, this is a Buddelschiff for Scharnhorst. What do you think?

Fields.MenuText: I think she'll like it!
Better make it grander. You know how Scharnhorst is.
You could put the ship in a bigger bottle, make it seem smaller. Mess with her a little bit.

Fields.DialogueText: I certainly hope she does. I'm going to have to build a lot of these to make back my Soldvorschuss.
Exzellent point. Wer die Musik bezahlt, bestimmt auch was gespielt wird.
I'd rather not be on the receiving end of her ire. Besides, she's paying good Geld.
Schiffsdame Emden, we have a message for you.
Who is it from?
The officer who went missing with your students.
Geben Sie her!
What does it say?
It says the Offizier is in... Portugal!
Portugal? Didn't you do some work in Portugal?
And all over the Iberische Atlantikküste. I'm quite the traveler, Kapitän! Everywhere has something to teach us.
*ALARM*
Say, do you think you might have time to make me one of those ships?
An intriguing challenge, Kapitän! You are not a Schiffsdame... so what Schiff would represent you? I will have to think on this.
@BATTLE
And of course the Diebe don't come cheap.
Please don't remind me how much we're paying for the privilege of working with Bible thieves.
Did the message say if your students were with the officer?
It did not. It just stated that the Offizier was in Lissabon, and that we were to pick him up there. I pray for the safe return of my Studenten.
Well, they might be there as well.
Lissabon is a busy Hafen. If they're not with the Offizier, it might be very difficult to find them.

Fields.MenuText: We'll just take this one step at a time.
What would they want with the officer in the first place?

Fields.DialogueText: Korrekt, Kapitän. We will be patient until we meet up with the Offizier. Man sall nich ehrder danzen, as de Fiedel geiht.
A liaison, I expect. My Studenten would be more relaxed around a familiar face, especially one belonging to an authority figure.
Do you think they were traveling west?
I have no idea. Supposing the Offizier kept his wits about him, he'll be our greatest source of Information.
*ALARM*
The Morganas have impeccable timing.
I wonder if they're equipped with some sort of device that allows them to show up at the most inconvenient times.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: What if we don't?

Fields.DialogueText: We're meant to, Kapitän. I have a feeling nobody steals from a Schiffsdame unless they're trying to get to her.
Maybe that's what the students have been working on.
Concerning thought.
Emden, our friend is onboard.
Herr Kapitänleutnant, are my Studenten with you? Please tell me that they are safe!
They are not, I'm afraid. We were separated before my escape. As soon as I was free, I searched for a means of telling you where I was.
Do you know where they are, or who took them?
A rogue contingent of Briten took your students. However, you won't find them in the Großbritannien. I believe they have been taken to Norway.
Why Norway?
There's a heavy water plant near Rjukan. No idea what that means, but the Entente have had an eye on that.

Fields.MenuText: Heavy water? How can you make water heavier?
This is confusing. Why would rogue Brits kidnap a group of German students when they're concerned with a Norwegian heavy water plant?
So is this sabotage or espionage?

Fields.DialogueText: This might be in reference to heavy Wasserstoffisotopen in the water.
Allow me to explain...
A bit of both, I think.
*ALARM*
It's time to vanquish the Morganas.
What a wilde Hatz we have been sent on... but now I think we can get zum Kern der Sache.
@BATTLE
All right, I need more information, Emden. I feel as if I'm not yet connecting the dots here.
Heavy water reacts way slower than normal water. And water in general is used as a Kühlmittel.
And I read an article about a physikalischen Prozess called "Kernspaltung"..... I'm not sure there is an international term for it, yet...  anyways a "Kernspaltung" sets off a huge amount of energy.
I don't understand how something with no charge to it can be used for energy.
I don't either, but a huge number of those "Kernspaltungen" could in theory power this Schiff. And to somehow control and cool that, they might seek heavy water.

Fields.MenuText: I still don't understand.
I think I know what you're saying...
You know a lot about... a lot, Fräulein Emden.

Fields.DialogueText: I think you and the Lieutenant need a crash course in Kernphysik.
Well done! Can you teach the Lieutenant, then?
I appreciate you saying so.
That still doesn't tell me why these Briten kidnapped the Studenten.
Maybe they suspect Germany to have advanced knowledge on the subject.
Emden's education in math, physics and chemistry made them highly sought after.
They're likely being housed in or near Rjukan. Speaking of...
Yes?
Before we reach Norwegen, we need to return to the Ostfriesischen Küste.
Why's that?
I require a few upgrades.
*ALARM*
Will the upgrades help us fight the Morganas?
And more besides. To think this was all happening nebenan...
@BATTLE
Paint? What type of upgrade is this?
Don't be so schockiert, Kapitän. This isn't ordinary Farbe. Take a closer look.
Hmm, it does look very thick.
This is ferrite-based Farbe.
What does it do?
You're aware that the British have new magnetic detonators, correct?
Yeah, they found some German ones after the Great War. I heard the Royal Navy did something with them.
Well, the chemische Komposition of the metals in this Farbe increases our Magnetfeld and should prematurely detonate any Magnetzünder.
That's incredible.
We use Magnetzünder mostly on U-Boote... hmm... U-Boote..
Emden?
Oh, my apologizes! I just realized I've never made a Buddel-U-Boot.

Fields.MenuText: Have anyone in particular in mind?
I think you ought to stick with regular ships.
What if you painted the ships in a special paint that absorbed all the light?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not sure yet. Perhaps you can make a few suggestions. Fräulein U-29 might be interested.
I don't know. U-Boote do so much of their work verborgen underwater. It might be nice for them to receive their due.
Then inside the Buddel would be a black Klumpen... easy on the eyes, but not much to look at.
Still, I'm just pleased an upgrade is happening. I've no doubt it will help in our search for the Studenten.
*ALARM*
Ready?
Ready.
@BATTLE
Kapitän, our Offiziere have captured one of the rogue Briten!
Where are my Studenten? What have you done with them?
Ma'am, I don't have your students.
We have multiple sources saying they were seen in your care.
They were here for a short time, but then they were moved. Say, you're a fine piece, aren't you? Your stems run on for miles.
Abschaum! I will make you eat those words!
You're going to want to stop talking.
Pfftt. Calm down, Captain. I didn't mean anything by it.
I'll see you out.

Fields.MenuText: Emden! Are you all right? I wasn't expecting him to treat you like that!
What a rude person.
He had no respect!

Fields.DialogueText: Schon gut. He just caught me off guard.
Allerdings. Danke for handling it, Kapitän.
I expected this from an Amerikaner, but not a Tommy.
*ALARM*
Al weer?! Don't let them stand in our way!
@BATTLE
What!? How?
The KaLeu has a photographic memory, and we encountered someone in the Hafen who matched one of his Zeichnungen.
We've brought the spy for interrogation, Schiffsdame.
Well, it is a fact. These... Briten have my Studenten. But as to their whereabouts? I'm not sure.
Let's consider what we know. We know that this group of radicals, or whatever they are, has your students...
Ja.
And that they're likely close to Norway.
That is also korrekt, Kapitän.
Where else do you have contacts, Emden?
My most extensive Netzwerk of Informanten operates in Stockholm. I can have them search for an Britische activities that might have a group of young people with them.
It might take a while to get your informants to Norway.
Information doesn't have to come from people. I was thinking about using Duuven.

Fields.MenuText: Pigeons?
Why not use spies?
What's the food in Sweden like?

Fields.DialogueText: Ja, Duuven are quite intelligent birds.
Duuven are much better at going unnoticed.
Have you heard of Surströmming?
In the Taunus the apothecarian Julius Neubronner trained Duuven to carry medicine over town.
He invented a Kamera small enough for Duuven to carry and take pictures on a delayed timer. Belgier have trained similar Duuven to come to Schiffe.
So, we're using pigeons to take pictures for us?
Indeed.
*ALARM*
Hopefully the pigeons will be good at spotting Morganas on your behalf.
@BATTLE
That one we captured was a pig, but he was a true believer. We couldn't get a thing out of him.
There's also the possibility that he really wasn't told any more than he needed to know. They must run a sensitive Unternehmen in that case.
I would not use them as Kanaris, Kapitän! Gottes creatures deserve better.
Where are the pigeons? I'd gotten used to their cooing.
Our away team took them outside of Rjukan. Once released, they will fly over the town before returning to our Schiff. Once they do, we'll develop the Photographien  they took.
What if we don't see the students?
It's a calculated Risiko. I think it's warranted.

Fields.MenuText: I still say you should have used spies.
Think the kidnappers have any falcons trained to take down pigeons?
Do pigeons taste good?

Fields.DialogueText: If the Duuven don't work out, we'll move on to Spione after that.
That would be quite unfortunate for us. I mean, they could remember from the Great War.
Have you ever eaten pullet? It's like dark chicken meat.
How fast do pigeons fly?
It depends on the distance. But because these birds are weighed down by the Kameras, they will be slower than most.
*ALARM*
Good thing the reconnaissance is inland. I wouldn't want the Duuven to get caught in the crossfire!
@BATTLE
It's interesting that you worry about that.
Of course I am concerned for the welfare of Gottes creatures. It is one way I know I am a Person and not merely a Waffe.
It's a good person that draws that distinction.
It's a better Person that remembers what it means to be one or the other.
You could certainly teach some classes on that.
All the more reason to accumulate photographischen evidence.
The Photographien from the Duuvenkameras have been developed! Look, right there. That is my Klasse!
I can't believe it. Those are your students! How are we going to get them back?
We'll have our Diebe retrieve them. However, we need to distract the Gegner in any way we can. We can't resort to attacking the Briten, especially on foreign soil.
What about luring in the Morganas and using them to do the dirty work for us?
Rjukan and the heavy water facility at Vemork are inland quite a bit. I'm afraid the Nixen will not work.

Fields.MenuText: You'll think of something. You're always clever like that.
Once again, my answer is spies!
Why don't we distract the enemy with some appelbeignet?

Fields.DialogueText: I appreciate the cheer, Kapitän.
A Gruppe needs Ausrüstung. We'd have to find plenty of Vehikel and supplies to transport my Klasse safely.
Let's hope that they have a sweet Zahn.
Maybe try crafting a ship and see what comes to mind? You said that always helps.
*ALARM*
It appears crafting must wait. Maybe something will come to mind as I uncraft these Nixen.
@BATTLE
To answer your forthcoming question, I have not quite decided on yours.
That's all right. I understand these things take time.
I fear my Aufträge must wait behind the rescue mission.
We can work out how to describe the world once we finish saving it.
My, you certainly have a way with words!
I told you I was paying attention during your literature lectures.
What are you doing, Emden?
I am trying to think of a plan to get the Studenten back that doesn't resort to any violent measures.
Ah, I see. I thought you were praying.
Gebete and deep thought are very similar! You're not far off.
Schiffsdame Emden, a telegram for you.
From who?
I didn't look...
What does it say?
It's a message from a person named Rasmus Priske. He says he's a colleague of Niels Bohr, and we're to meet him in Gothenburg, Sweden.

Fields.MenuText: Who's Niels Bohr?
What does Priske - or Bohr - want with you?
Why Sweden?

Fields.DialogueText: Niels Bohr won a Nobelpreis for his work on atomic structure in 1922. He's a highly respected Physiker.
I am not sure. Perhaps my Kontakte felt he would be useful.
I have no idea. I suspect because they are neutral and not adjacent to the Reich.
*ALARM*
We'll save this Geheimnis for later. While I admire their tenacity, these Nixen are getting on my Nerven.
@BATTLE
Rasmus Priske to see Schiffsdame Emden.
Guten Tag, Schiffsdame Emden.
Guten Tag, Herr Priske. What brings you to our Schiff?
I have a request, Schiffsdame Emden. Perhaps you can help a friend of mine?
Who would that be?
He is a scientist of Jewish descent, and is trying to flee to the United States. I am the middleman in his journey.
But I imagine the middleman has a Preis?
My friend is looking to trade information he has regarding the heavy water plant in Norway for safe passage to the United States. But I need assistance in setting up the meeting with the Americans.
I had heard of the students' abduction. I thought if you were willing to help set up the meeting, we could bargain for my friend's safe passage and your students' release.
Your friend... he has the heavy water plant information with him, right now?
Yes. He has it with him. We're just in need of support.

Fields.MenuText: This could work perfectly!

Fields.DialogueText: *ALARM*
Why am I not surprised? Get Priske below where it's safe.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: Is it really wise to be getting more people involved?
This could be valuable to the war effort.

Fields.DialogueText: Whatever it takes. We're fortunate to find someone as desperate as we.
As long as we all have something to gain, I trust our Mitverschwörer to keep their word.
One step at a time, Kapitän. We need to keep our Ziel in mind.
Uh-huh. So I take it name-dropping Nils Bohr was just to help you get your foot in the door?
More like presenting my bona fides. I wasn't lying.
If there's a way for me to profit from this, I'm afraid I haven't been clever enough to stumble onto it.
Emden, did you receive word from Bohr's friend?
I did! And the Informationen he has is sound - there's no doubt the Amerikaner will be interested in what he knows. And they're willing to tell the Brits.

Fields.MenuText: Excellent! So the Briten will just give you back your students, right?
I wonder what the Americans are going to do with this information?
Once this is all over, I'll be glad to get some German food.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not willing to hope for the best. I will have the Diebe in place, ready to retrieve my Studenten should the situation deteriorate.
It's hard to say. Maybe for powering the country, or powering Schiffe perhaps? Our Schiffe need as much energy as we can get for this war. And I told it would be one idea.
We Germans know how to make deftiges Essen, don't we?
Our Offiziere will accompany Rasmus and his friend to Rjukan. While the meeting takes place, the Diebe will locate our Klasse at the plant at Vemork and notify us when they are secure.
After all is said and done, we meet at a rendezvous point at the Kanaren.
Why the Canary Islands?
Far from Norwegen and quite sunny. They could use the Urlaub.
*ALARM*
I guess this paint doesn't work on Morganas...
For now. Knowledge will march on.
@BATTLE
It seems the Americans are getting that information then as well. And the Brits aren't that rogue after all.
If it saves my Studenten, sharing some knowledge is a small price to pay. I think we brought enough for the entire Klasse, as it were.
The University will be certainly be pleased to have its students back!
As will the NSLB. It wouldn't reflect well for one of its brightest Gastvorleser to lose a whole Klasse.
The meeting should have started... precisely two Minuten ago.
What's next?
We wait for word of whether Rasmussens Plan went as scheduled, or if our Diebe have retrieved the Studenten.
Huh, somehow I thought there would be more action to this...
Planning is key here. When the Plan works, more drastische measures are not needed.

Fields.MenuText: But I really wanted a battle!
I can't just sit around and wait!
Any ideas in the meantime?

Fields.DialogueText: I'm also anxious about the return of my Studenten. Why don't we focus on some Aufrüstungen while we wait?
I think the Nixen will ensure that you won't be waiting for long.
Perhaps it is time for you to find a Steckenpferd. Any thoughts? I can finish my Buddelscharnhorst. I still need to work on some details.
Hmm... maybe we should see about getting new detection systems.
I think I'll abstain from Angelsächsischer Technologie for now. How about better Ferngläser? We do have superior Ferngläser.
*ALARM*
See, if I had better Ferngläser, these Nixen could have been spotted sooner. Who's to say that they don't have better Ferngläser than us? They are constantly learning...
@BATTLE
... Okay, I have to ask. What kind of ship *would* I be?
As tempting as it is to suggest a Kreuzerr like me... I consider you more of a Zerstörer.
How's that?
Flexible and patient. Most of the Zerstörer I know are the most adaptable girls in the Welt.
I'm looking forward to your interpretation all the more.
Sounds reasonable. You'll never hear me say no to good binoculars. They can be a better investment than heavy armor.
You'll never be a Schlachtschiff with an attitude like that.
I hadn't realized being a battleship was even an option for me.
The Nixe is near. I can feel them. Make everyone clear zum Gefecht.
How much time do we have?
None. Alle Mann auf Gefechtsstation! Schnell, schnell, schnell!
@BATTLE
Emden, look at this dessert. It's a rice and coconut cake.
I can't eat at a time like this, Kapitän! The meeting went south, so we're stuck here waiting to see whether the Diebe were able to retrieve the Klasse.
Not even a tiny bite of dessert?
Not even that. I'm way too nervös.

Fields.MenuText: Where's that bottle of Apfelwein? Maybe try to calm your nerves?
I'm sure everyone, including your students, will arrive shortly.
Less food for you is more food for the captain.

Fields.DialogueText: I drank it all two Gefechte ago. My rationing proved... not worth it.
You are right. I must have Vertrauen.
Don't be too distracted. We must be wachsam.
There is a boat approaching, Schiffsdame Emden.
Let me have your Fernglas, Kapitän! I can't bear the wait.
I hope it's good news.
It's a familiar Boot! I am heading down to see if my Studenten are safe!
There is so much at stake here, Kapitän. The lives of the Studenten, first and foremost.
But with them rides my influence on the NSLB and their curriculum reforms. The very fabric of education in the Reich...
They can't blame you for this. They'd really turn down their best-read Belle over the actions of foreign spies?
There are other Schiffsdamen, Kapitän... many of whom would be happy to let the Partei sweep aside time-honored German Ideale and Traditionen.
Purpose-built by man and Gott for this exact Moment... I cannot simply allow my expertise to go unheeded.
This can't be!
The students aren't here?!
Our Diebe retrieved them, but the Briten didn't want to let them go, then the Amerikaner sided with them! The Diebe are laying low in Oslo, looking for some means of escape.
We must go rescue them, Kapitän!
I thought you didn't want to fight?
This is different! My Studenten are not safe!

Fields.MenuText: Do you have a plan?
I thought for certain this plan would have worked.
Norway again? Who knew a place so cold would have such valuable commodities?

Fields.DialogueText: Not yet... but I am never far from one.
It seems that everywhere I go, my Studenten are not safe. I need to find an undisclosed location for them to be in.
It's interesting how nature works that way, isn't it?
Should we harness the power of the Morganas now, Emden?
I believe it's time, Kapitän!
Agreed. Think you can work up a battle plan to present to me by 06:00?
It would be a pleasure.
Distractions permitting, of course....
*ALARM*
I'll try to formulate something. Do keep up.
@BATTLE
What's the plan?
I am planning on harnessing the power of the Nixen. It involves Modelle.
Like, fashion models? Perfect posture and come-hither eyes?
... You make much more confusing Pläne than I do.
Heh. Okay, so, what sort of models are you talking about?
Modelle von Schiffen, just on a grander scale. We create metallene cutouts of Schiffsdamenschiffe and play recordings of their Motoren. This is to lure in the Nixe.
Once we're near Oslo, the Angelsachsen will have their hands full with the incoming Nixen.

Fields.MenuText: You're good at building small models. Do you think you have enough time to build bigger ones?
There's a sentence I never thought I'd hear you say.
Where do we start luring Morganas?

Fields.DialogueText: These are crude Scherenschnitte that only need to be convincing from a distance. I'm certain the Mannschaft will enjoy learning how to paint them.
I suppose even I can be swept around by the Winde of change.
It looks like we will have to start collecting Nixen from the Noordsee. We'll start in the Nederland, move toward Denemark, and make our way up to Oslo.
We'd better stop at a port that has enough construction material.
Exzellente Idee. It will give me time to sketch out some Diagramme.
*ALARM*
These Morganas are off to an early start!
It only means we'll be off to an early Sieg.
@BATTLE
This should give the Diebe the opportunity to escape with my Klasse!
The Köder are in place. Start up the audio.
Why do I have butterflies in my stomach?
Is it from Vorfreude or from Nervosität?

Fields.MenuText: Excitement, certainly excitement.
It's from nerves.
Probably a bit of both...

Fields.DialogueText: I am glad you are excited and not nervous. The lives of the Studenten are at risk.
Maybe have a drink to calm yourself, Kapitän?
Well, put the Fokus on the Vorfreude, would you?
Hey, those are my German optic binoculars! What are you doing with them?
Look, there's something on the Horizont already!
I would be able to look, but someone took my binoculars from me.
Ach ja. Here you go.
*ALARM*
Here we go. The first Morgana.
Now remember, the key is to have them follow us. Make Kleinholz of those who get too close...
@BATTLE
I can't believe this is working.
Don't hold your breath yet. We still have a bit of See to kreuzen.
I don't think I can hold my breath that long!
Try to think of a good Infinitesimalrechnung to solve in your head to calm your Nerven. I'm sure there was one or two you had a hard time with in my Unterricht.

Fields.MenuText: I guess now is a good time to admit that I never paid attention in your class.
These Morganas in tow make me nervous.
How strong is your Apfelwein? You don't seem nervous at all!

Fields.DialogueText: What were you doing the entire time in my Unterricht, then?
While the Nixen are close enough, we should take the time to study them. It's an opportunity to learn.
I might have distilled it and made Apfelbran instead.
... Let me have a swig of that Apfelbrand.
Look, I think more Nixen are approaching!
@BATTLE
Drop the anchor on the decoy and cut the line! Increase fuel to the engines. We need to leave!
Ja, let's leave while the Nixen are distracted.
I didn't know you rigged actual munitions on the decoys...
Well, I needed to fool the Nixen as long as possible.
Lieutenant!
Yes, Captain?
Full speed to our charted course of the Canary Islands?
Yes, Captain!

Fields.MenuText: Might we prolong our mission while we're there?
Are you excited to get your students back?
What's the speed of your ship?

Fields.DialogueText: ... If we were in Madeira, perhaps. The wine's better.
There's no word on whether our Diebe were able to sneak them out of Oslo just yet. We won't know until we get to the rendezvous point.
Twenty-nine and a half knots, Kapitän. Not the fastest journey, but I will enjoy getting there.
*ALARM*
I thought the Morganas were distracted by the decoy.
There must have been some stragglers. Some Nixen are certainly faster than others.
@BATTLE
Meine Studenten! They're all safe! Oh, I should never have doubted the eleven...
As long as they got their cut, I don't think there's anything they wouldn't have done.

Fields.MenuText: I am glad you have your students back safe and sound!
Everyone has their role, Emden. You're fulfilling a pivotal one.
I think I'm just about as happy as you that this crazy adventure is over.

Fields.DialogueText: Danke, Kapitän! Your perseverance is impressive. I couldn't have done it without you.
Gott will forgive me if I devote my life to uplifting His people.
It was quite the Abenteuer, but just think how much we have learned from it.
Now I can get back to focusing on battles and upgrading ships.
I do love an Aufrüstung. Please consider me, Kapitän.
*ALARM*
Oh! Speaking of Aufrüstungen... I finished your Auftrag.
Is now really the best time to make me aware of that?
@BATTLE
Stimmt. Much as I hate to enable human Sünde... it has served a greater good today.
Before a matter of life and death? Wann, wenn nicht jetzt?. Promise me you'll come looking for your Buddelschiff should we survive?
When we survive.
Recht so!
So where to now?
We need to drop the Studenten off at a third location. Buenos Aires should be ideal.
Why there?
Like Sweden, Argentina is neutral and safe. But also far away enough from the Angelsachsen to go looking. I've arranged for the OKM to collect them there.

Fields.MenuText: Rather an interesting place for a group of German engineering students.
I've never been to Argentina before.
I know Buenos Aires like the back of my hand!

Fields.DialogueText: I admit they too were excited at the prospect of Argentine wine.
It's an interesting geographical location. I am certain my Studenten will learn quite a bit.
Well, we should go on a Trip then! Of the Bereiche I can reach, anyway. There must be some Uferpromenadencafés I can visit.
Speaking of dinner... is now a good time for dessert?
You do know me, Kapitän. I was thinking along the lines of a little Zucker.
Huh?
A Kuss, just for you.
Fräulein Emden!
Kapitän! Why did you steal from me?
I've never stolen anythi...
You've stolen more than enough. You've stolen my Herz. I'm afraid you will have to nachsitzen! I expect to see you after the Unterricht.
Besides, we can maybe get some of exotic wine after our Urlaub on the Kanaren.
Didn't you say a little theft was tolerable in the name of a greater good?
Using my Widersprüche against me? Perhaps you have aufgepasst.
Then perhaps it's time to progress to more advanced lessons...
Ah! While we're at it... did you like your Buddelschiff?
A lot, Fräulein Emden. You really put a lot of thought into it. I may not be a ship... but I'm honored that you could see me in that way.
I was thinking about this during Abendessen, Kapitän. Imagination is as important as knowledge. How else would one put theirs to innovativen use?
We certainly saved the students with a healthy mix of both.
"Perhaps" I have? Emden, I always pay attention to you. Even in calculus classes, believe it or not.
